snippet: The release of the filings, after similar releases for three other highly caffeinated energy drinks, appears to underscore the crazy-quilt regulatory pattern governing such products.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration publicly releases reports of injuries citing the possible involvement of Red Bull, country's top-selling energy drink, days after its producer said it was unaware of such cases.
lead_paragraph: The release of the filings, after similar releases for three other highly caffeinated energy drinks, appears to underscore the crazy-quilt regulatory pattern governing such products.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Posts Injury Data Citing Red Bull
headline.main: F.D.A. Posts Injury Data Citing Red Bull
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Posts Injury Data For Red Bull
